content:
We are meeting today at 4pm EDT on the FHIR IG: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/PHWG/2021-10-12+SHC-VT+ballot+reconciliation+meeting

On the agenda:

  • A few issues related to the constraints on vaccineCode
  • Allowing gender in the AD profile of Patient
  • @Isaac Vetter's comment on performer.actor.display and another issue on this

Links to all the issues on the agenda and the Zoom link are at the Confluence link above.
Minutes are posted here. Thanks to everyone who attended!
I couldn't attend. I wish I could. This is a remarkable statement:
SHCs don't identify people
i mean, you have to identify someone to make use of the SHC. otherwise it's just bytes flapping in the wind.
Maybe you actually mean 'an SHC is not intended to establish the identity of a person without additional identification material' or something like that

and then you could say 'we don't think that gender is necessary given that' - which is why gender would be optional. But when you prohibit it, you say, 'we believe that no jurisdiction can ever make a policy that gender needs to be represented', or 'if they do, we want them not to use SHCs'
(this is not about Australia, btw. Australian covid certs don't include gender, I'm thinking of several asian countries; I don't know whether they'll care strongly though)
https://spec.smarthealth.cards/#can-a-smart-health-card-be-used-as-a-form-of-identification is where we adderss this in the core framework -- hopefully this is clear @Grahame Grieve ?
yes that's clear enough. The wording in the minutes was the problem, though the minutes are not important.

re: gender, there are many, many ways to mis-use this as a field in the context of a SMART Health Card; because of this, in the US-based profiles we can be proscriptive. I don't expect this is true in all jurisdictions.
that's why I'm nervous about AD disallowing it. Fine with DM not allowing it

with regard to FHIR#33728:

the minutes say "leaning towards not persuasive based on the above". The task says:

As such, I think we should reconsider its destination as must support. I would be in favor of moving lot number from the data minimizing profile into the allowable data profile.

not persausive for both? I'd like to know whether that comment is about both. I think it shouldn't be must support, since real world implementations don't support it
@Grahame Grieve and @Josh Mandel, we will find some time to talk live with you about gender in the AD profile.
Are you able to make the 4pm EDT Tues time next week? (If this is too late/early for you, Grahame, we can set up a different time.)
I can, yes. I intended to join the call today but had product director business instead :-(
No worries...we'll plan on discussing again next week if you can join? Would also be good to have you for some vocabulary-related discussion for vaccineCode as well if you've got the time.
I'm planning to be there.
Thanks!
I will plan to join as well.
